title: SIMD.js
body: Implement Single Instruction Multiple Data (SIMD) in Internet Explorer.

comments.body: Glad to see it is in Chakra!

This is no doubt a good technology to improve Javascript performance.
I believe HTML5 gaming will be accelerated by SIMD.js, say physics, skinning and image processing etc., Looking forward to seeing this feature in IE!
This is something we are looking for to aelerate the JavaScript performance
SIMD is very important for performance and looking forward to its availability!
You can push the boundaries of HTML5/JS in IE even further by implementing SIMD.js

SIMD.js on IE will be the golden touch for performance-hungry JavaScript.
Go, SIMD!!
This will enable performance improvements for a set of applications such as image processing apps.

Enables use of SIMD primitives from user level JS code.  A low level cross platform API.  This further reduces the performance gap between JS and native and allows for use of powerful SIMD (SSE/NEON) instructions available in modern CPUs from JS.

Enable Single Instruction, Multiple Data instructions to be used from Javascript programs.
